contents: While I was young I lived upon my mother's milk, as I could not eat grass. In the daytime I ran by her side, and at night I lay down close by her. When it was hot we used to stand by the pond in the shade of the trees, and when it was cold we had a nice warm shed near the grove.  As soon as I was old enough to eat grass my mother used to go out to work in the daytime, and come back in the evening.
